About Me

Few things about me...

BIO

I was fortunate enough to work alongside a  front-end developer, so I can have a life-time of what suits me.

Coders Lab

Front-end bootcamp

A very intensive programming course for 7 weeks, 8h/day and an exam for every module to stay in the program. The combo of theory with practical examples in the class and much more complex exercises for solving on my own daily was a very efficient way of building a solid foundation for web development.
Here I used Webstorm IDE, Git for version control and Linux - Ubuntu as my OS to study the technologies that I'm now using in my portfolio of applications.

Learning path

I'm working on applications to deepen my knowledge of the following:

  • HTML, CSS, Sass
  • RWD, Accessibility
  • JavaScript, ES6, jQuery, React
  • NPM, Webpack, AJAX, JSON, REST APIs

Background

The counselor's game

I have been working for a few years in public institutions doing different administrative office activities and prepare and verify the documentation for submission. The required attention for details helped me to discover coding and enjoying my first developed game.
